org.fun.music.midi_player

Class MidiPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fun.music.midi_player.MidiPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.util.EventListener, javax.sound.midi.MetaEventListener

    public class MidiPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.sound.midi.MetaEventListener, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    A MIDI player.

    This class encapsulate all the methods necessary to open a MIDI Sequencer, play songs (one at a time) and manage a playlist.

    A thread is used to navigate through the playlist when reaching the end of a song or when user requests a change.

    Author:
    Mathieu Brunot
    See Also:
    MidiPlayer.MidiThread, The Official MIDI Specifications , An example that plays a MIDI sequence

      • getTempoFactor

        public final java.lang.Float getTempoFactor()
        Returns the current tempo factor for the sequencer.

        The default is 1.0.

        Returns:
        tempo factor.
        See Also:
        setTempoFactor(float)

      • setTempoFactor

        public void setTempoFactor(float tempoFactor)
        Scales the sequencer's actual playback tempo by the factor provided.

        The default is 1.0. A value of 1.0 represents the natural rate (the tempo specified in the sequence), 2.0 means twice as fast, etc.

        Note that the tempo factor cannot be adjusted when external synchronization is used. In that situation, setTempoFactor always sets the tempo factor to 1.0.

        Parameters:
        tempoFactor - the requested tempo scalar
        See Also:
        getTempoFactor()

        public java.lang.Long getMicrosecondPosition()

        Returns:

      • moveSongsTo

        public boolean moveSongsTo(int start,
                           int end,
                           int position)
        Rotates the resources in the playlist between start and end indexes to the specified position index.
        Parameters:
        start - start index (inclusive) of the sublist of elements in the playlist to move
        end - end index (inclusive) of the sublist of elements in the playlist to move
        position - index of the destination for the sublist
        Returns:
        true if the elements were moved, false if the position is between start and end
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the start is greater than the end index

      • shufflePlaylist

        public boolean shufflePlaylist()
        Randomly permutes the specified playlist using a default source of randomness.

        All permutations occur with approximately equal likelihood.

        Returns:
        true if the playlist was shuffled
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the specified list or its list-iterator does not support the set operation.

      • shufflePlaylist

        public boolean shufflePlaylist(java.util.Random random)
        Randomly permute the playlist using the specified source of randomness.

        All permutations occur with equal likelihood assuming that the source of randomness is fair.

        Parameters:
        random - the source of randomness to use to shuffle the playlist.
        Returns:
        true if the playlist was shuffled
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the specified list or its list-iterator does not support the set operation.

      • sortPlaylist

        public boolean sortPlaylist()
        Sorts the playlist according to the order induced by the specified comparator.
        Returns:
        true if the playlist was sorted
        See Also:
        COMPARATOR, List.sort(Comparator)

      • sortPlaylist

        public boolean sortPlaylist(java.util.Comparator<java.lang.Object> comparator)
        Sorts the playlist according to the order induced by the specified comparator.
        Parameters:
        comparator - the comparator to determine the order of the list. A null value indicates that the elements' natural ordering should be used.
        Returns:
        true if the playlist was sorted
        See Also:
        List.sort(Comparator)

      • add

        public boolean add(java.lang.Object resource)
        Appends the specified resource to the end of this list.
        Parameters:
        resource - resource to be appended to the playlist
        Returns:
        true if the playlist changed as a result of the call

      • add

        public boolean add(int index,
                   java.lang.Object resource)
        Inserts the specified element at the specified position in this list.

        Shifts the element currently at that position (if any) and any subsequent elements to the right (adds one to their indices).

        Parameters:
        index - index at which the specified element is to be inserted
        resource - resource to be inserted
        Returns:
        true if the playlist changed as a result of the call
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index > size())

      • addAll

        public boolean addAll(java.util.Collection<? extends java.lang.Object> resources)
        Appends all of the resources in the specified collection to the end of this player's resource, in the order that they are returned by the specified collection's iterator.

        The behavior of this operation is undefined if the specified collection is modified while the operation is in progress. (Note that this will occur if the specified collection is this list, and it's nonempty.)

        Parameters:
        resources - the resources to add to playlist
        Returns:
        true if the playlist changed as a result of the call

      • addAll

        public boolean addAll(int index,
                      java.util.Collection<? extends java.lang.Object> resources)
        Inserts all of the resources in the specified collection into this player's playlist, starting at the specified position.

        Shifts the element currently at that position (if any) and any subsequent elements to the right (increases their indices). The new elements will appear in the list in the order that they are returned by the specified collection's iterator.

        Parameters:
        index - index at which to insert the first element from the specified collection
        resources - the resources to add to playlist
        Returns:
        true if the playlist changed as a result of the call
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index > size())

      • remove

        public boolean remove(int index)
        Removes the resource at the specified index in this player's playlist.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the resource to remove from playlist
        Returns:
        true if this player's playlist changed as a result of the call, false if no song exists at the given index or if the playlist did not change

      • removeAll

        public boolean removeAll(int[] indexes)
        Removes all of this player's playlist resources at the specified indexes.
        Parameters:
        indexes - array of playlist resources' indexes to remove
        Returns:
        true if this player's playlist changed as a result of the call

      • clear

        public boolean clear()
        Removes all of the elements from the player's playlist.

        The playlist will be empty after this call returns.

        Returns:
        true if playlist was cleared.
